name: places/ChIJcxklv2X2wokRGAiyl1eQQOU
formattedAddress: 538 W 138th St, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 538 W 138th St, New York, NY 10031, USA

editorialSummary.text: Family-owned supermarket chain with major-brand general groceries & a variety of fresh goods.

originalText.text:
I've been shopping at Food Universe for almost seven years (since summer 2016), and it has usually been a reliable place to buy basic groceries. About a year ago, the store underwent a gradual--but extensive--makeover which has made the shopping experience more pleasant, even though product selection has remained much the same. BUT...

...my biggest concern with the store--and the main reason shoppers should be wary of shopping here--is that the management *routinely* advertises false prices for goods or does not label prices at all. It is extremely common to see the price advertised as one thing (even with a recent price label, such as for sale items) and then to see the prices $1-2 higher for that item at checkout. Recent examples just from my last shopping trip (see attached photos): a jar of tomato sauce (advertised price: $6.99; actual price: $7.99), avocados (advertised price: $0.99 each; actual price: $2 each), chia seeds (advertised price: $7.99; actual price: $9.29). Importantly, these discrepancies have nothing to do with the shopper's club discount, which everyone seems to get regardless of having signed up. Everyone has noticed increases in grocery prices over the last few years as a result of ongoing inflation. But the situation at Food Universe is not about inflation. This is about mis-advertising prices in a highly unethical way that possibly violates NYC consumer protection laws as well. Twice, I have approached staff about these discrepancies, and have gotten just a shrug.

If you are interested in a better shopping experience in the broader Hamilton Heights area, I would recommend the Super Food Town at 161st Street, which is bigger, better, and cheaper. Honestly, even the Key Foods at 146th Street is at least as good as Food Universe in terms of product quality, and is definitely cheaper.

originalText.text: Hey be careful I was there on 9/12/2023 got  a couple of things for my mom with the snap benefits and left and come to notice there was $209 stolen I went to the second cashier be careful check your cards before and after your purchase (You say you have that but your supermarket was the only place I used it that day and There’s a few people I know that’s including my aunt that got their snap stolen and they went to this supermarket as well so it’s not 1 person it’s a few and different days I see someone said they went the 5th I went the 12 and there’s is a few people went different days

originalText.text: On September 5th 2023 I went to this supermarket on 138th and broadway and used my ebt card data was stolen to rob me of $100 in food stamps!!!!   It has to be a employee that works there skimming device they take your card number and password and rob your food stamps!!!   Don't use no cards at this supermarket!!!!

originalText.text:
Great selection, renovations are also fantastic...

I will say though that it's annoying to me sometimes it's hard to find prices of items or they're just flat out wrong as mentioned in previous reviews.

originalText.text:
Watch out. Fool the customer is their motto. Bait and switch is their mantra.
I need a shower after shopping there. Family of thieves.
